body.p:
Post Office, Louisville Ky
March 22d 1861
Dear Sir.
I have constantly, in the discharge of the duties of my office, need of the authority to administer the Post-Office Oath --
If you have authority, in the recess of the senate, would you object to appointing me a notary public?

I am very Respectfully
Your Obedient Serv't
William L. Kelly
Assist. Post-Master

His Excellency
B. Magoffin
Govr. of Kentucky.

Jefferson Co.
W. L. Kelly
Notary
Issd Mar. 24. 1862
